author: Oscar Pascual
title: German parliament votes to allow access to medical marijuana
text:
German parliament votes to allow access to medical marijuana By   19, 2017 at 1:27 PM Print 
German lawmakers have approved a law further easing the access of medical marijuana. 
Germany’s lower house of parliament voted unanimously on Thursday to allow marijuana prescriptions for people with serious illnesses, reports the Associated Press . 
The bill allows patients with qualifying conditions such as multiple sclerosis and chronic pain to be treated with cannabis “in very limited exceptional cases,” although patients will not be allowed to grow their own medicinal pot. 
“Those who are severely ill need to get the best possible treatment and that includes health insurance funds paying for cannabis as a medicine for those who are chronically ill if they can’t be effectively treated any other way,” said health minister Hermann Gröhe. 
Although medical marijuana was technically legal in Germany, patients had to undergo a complicated process to be granted special authorization, and had to pay for their own medicine out of pocket. Now patients can obtain a simple doctor’s prescription will be refunded the upfront cost from their health insurance. 
The International   promises to provide an update on Germany’s new medical marijuana laws at their San Francisco event on February 17, and has scheduled an April event to be held in Berlin . 
The law is likely to take effect in March after a procedural reading by the parliament’s upper house. Oscar Pascual
